website_summaries.verdict: A terrific solution for apartments and other cramped quarters.
cons: As a door model, it has a tendency to sway and bow out

customer_reviews.title: GREAT! BUT - Read this if your kitty struggles coming down
customer_reviews.text: I would love to give this product 5 stars because we enjoy it immensely but it did require an important hack. We wall mounted the unit into drywall (no stud) with average anchors and wood screws which provided plenty of stability. However kitties just couldn't navigate the narrow steps - especially coming down. Our solution was to drill one new hole on each shelf and shift shelves approx 3 more inches past their already offset position. This is exactly what was needed! See video of kitty coming down climber with no fear. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: AJMitchell

customer_reviews.title: Versatile, attractive climbing tree
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to install on the side of a linen closet to give my cat access to a high tray light shelf. I watched the video on how to put it together, had no trouble putting it together. I removed the metal grooves that are meant to attach to a door and used one of the shelves to provide support. It works beautifully and the cat loves it. This cat tree is attractive and versatile and I would recommend it for anyone with a cat that is always looking for a new adventure.
customer_reviews.author: Karla Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Crazy climbing cats
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for a few years. It is nice at first and can handle quite a bit of jumping and climbing from our rambunctious kitties. After awhile it started to fall apart and seem not so sturdy. We decided to disassemble it and reconstruct it in a permanent and more study way. I really love what we were able to do with it. It's gotten a second life and our cats love it. It was a great buy for the price. Also, if you sprinkle a little catnip on it your cats will climb and play all night!
customer_reviews.author: Heather N

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I purchased this!
customer_reviews.text: Our two ragdolls took about 30 seconds to figure this out. They are up and down, and really enjoy it. I am 77, and assembled it by myself. My husband snapped it into place. It was too heavy for me to handle. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Mccormack

customer_reviews.title: Versatile cat tower
customer_reviews.text: This cat climber goes together pretty quickly and is very sturdy. The materials seem to be of a pretty good quality. What I like best about this product is how versatile it can be in terms of where you place it and how you use it. I left out two segments and anchored the rest into a brick wall in order to give my cat access to a high window. It works great and my cat loves it.
customer_reviews.author: rmweston

customer_reviews.title: This is amazing. It was super easy to assemble (even though ...
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing. It was super easy to assemble (even though the instructions were not well written) it is very easy to figure out. This is VERY heavy duty which is important for me because my Bengals are very rough with stuff. It took me a minute to get it on my door but once up looks great. It does bow in the middle like most people have said but nothing a screw or tied down can't handle. I would recommend this to anyone and will definitely by again if I ever need to replace this one. I posted photos of my three Bengals immediately getting on the climber. They love it!!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Just Wouldn't Work
customer_reviews.text: Loved the concept of having a perch / tree for the cat that was out-of-the-way. Once it was assembled and attached to the door, the great concept ended. Cat used it one time!! The center part of the climber wouldn't tighten up. We had tightened the climber as much as we could, but the center portion was still wobbly. Not sure how some were able to get theirs to work, but short of nailing or gluing to door, nothing we did helped.
customer_reviews.author: C. Farber

customer_reviews.title: Horrible horrible tiny no way the cats can turn around ...
customer_reviews.text: Horrible horrible tiny no way the cats can turn around and the whole thing wobbles and shakes! YouTube has some great footage on why you should NOT BUY THIS!!! Great concept again I wanted this to be a good product but there is just no way and btw the assembly is horrific! Seriously!!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth F. Connelly

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: We gave this product 5 stars because: 1. It was easy to assemble. 2. It was "flexible" enough that we made it our own. We installed it on the wall, instead of the door, and installed only 3 shelves instead of 4. 3. It looks great with our decoration. The neutral colors do not make it stand out. 4. Most importantly, after one week of "testing" the kitties decided they like it. See pics.
customer_reviews.author: Aida

customer_reviews.title: I really like the product and I hope I can just have ...
customer_reviews.text: The product I received came with an incorrect part that's not even listed in the assembly instructions. It was supposed to have three middle parts, I only received two. I wasn't able to fully assemble it. I really like the product and I hope I can just have the company send me the part I need to fully assemble it.
customer_reviews.author: Cleetis

customer_reviews.title: An ill conceived idea: stick to regular cat tree
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't fit door correctly, heavy, clunky and ended up in the garbage a week after assembly. I couldn't bother to disassemble and return. I don't know why I didn't consider this but if you plan to actually operate the door it's hanging on, forget it. My cats showed zero interest.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not for us
customer_reviews.text: Well......this had to be modified quite a bit in order for use. Even after securing this to the wall, only one of my four cats will use this occasionally. It's just too difficult for them to move from step to step. The material on the steps is thin and already shredding. I was trying to save some money, but should have just sucked it up and bought a better cat tower.
customer_reviews.author: kmmom

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for active and height-loving cats
customer_reviews.text: I’ve now bought two of these. It’s a pain to assemble. I did it alone, but it took me a couple hours. You really need an extra set of hands though. Especially if balancing heavy stuff while using two hands to tighten bolts sounds difficult. I used boxes and book piles to get the pieces at the right heights since that gets hard quickly. I will agree with other reviewers that it can be disconcerting (and noisy) unless you strap the middle of this against the door with something. My husband suggested duct tape. That’s an awful idea. A luggage belt works great just cinch it tight and the stairs won’t budge.
customer_reviews.author: mleet87

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love it and we love it!
customer_reviews.text: We mounted it on the wall between windows instead of hanging on a door. The girls mainly use it as a ladder to get to the very top, but they do enjoy running up and down, scratching it and hanging out on the shelves as well. It's sturdy, the nicest looking and least obtrusive cat tree you can get for a reasonable price. Highly recommend! FYI: I did try it on a door and while it worked, it did wobble some when the cats jumped on it. So, Depending on the thickness of your doors, you may need to find a way keep it completely snug.
customer_reviews.author: mompie

customer_reviews.title: My cats love their new loft!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! I wall mounted it so my cars could have access to a cut out in our living room. It took about a week for them to get the hang of it but now they're all about their new loft! easy to put together, sturdy and safe. I removed the door brackets and wall mounted it. The neural color is unobtrusive to the rest of the room.
customer_reviews.author: JKS

customer_reviews.title: Unsafe
customer_reviews.text: This product is unstable. The shelves and based do not stay held together after assembly or during installation. As I was installing the Cat Climber, the whole thing came apart and several shelves/sections of the base fell off. I would not trust it to hold my cat's weight. The box and product itself also gave off a horrible chemical smell so strong it actually made me light headed while I was assembling it. Some reviewers have suggested wall-mounting the Cat Climber which might be a good solution if you have that option but I can't speak to that. Absolutely would not recommend and I would encourage the seller to assess the safety of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome design, flawed execution.
customer_reviews.text: The design is great and the space saving aspect is awesome for small apartments. Both my cats love it and I am fostering some kittens right now that practically live on it. Cons: no matter how tight I try to make it, it bounces away from my door and making a huge racket. I can tell when my rambunctious adult cat is climbing it because it sounds like it could wake the neighbors. Also, the fabric is super flimsy and one cat with a good scratch session destroyed one of the steps.
customer_reviews.author: KLang

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be a hit with my 5
customer_reviews.text: I have two 15 plus pound Turkish Vans and 3 Van kittens and they have all gotten on it and they are thrilled with it, it is there stairway to the cat walk.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly King

customer_reviews.title: came missing parts and isn't like it is pictured
customer_reviews.text: This item is very hard to put together, came missing parts and isn't like it is pictured. The overlap is too great for the cats to go from 1 shelf to another, they have to be on the very edge of the lower platform to attempt to get to the next one. The cats won't go near it. :(
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Neither cat can climb it, or won't climb it ...
customer_reviews.text: Neither cat can climb it, or won't climb it, needs wider shelves, even 2 inches would help. And maybe a little closer together with more "indent" between. Had to drill into wall to keep it from swaying and making so much noise when door mounted, the extra sturdiness did not entice them to climb at all. Shelf one (bottom) they will hop up to for a treat, but only for a treat. Simply not wide enough.
customer_reviews.author: Phae

customer_reviews.title: Hate it! Very poor design
customer_reviews.text: Hate it! Very poor design! Extremely hard to put together and even harder to put it on the door. Very heavy and unsteady. NOT safe to use unless you mount it to the walls with screws.
customer_reviews.author: Irene

customer_reviews.title: I am really disappointed. I purchased this item in April and it ...
customer_reviews.text: If I could I would leave 0 star. The product has a really strong smell. I have 3 cats and none of them would even get close to it because of the strong smell. And it doesn’t fit on any of my doors. I have standard door so when I attached the bottom part, my door wouldn’t close. I am really disappointed. I purchased this item in April and it still smells. Hard to describe the smell. It’s not pleasant at all. My cats hate it. It’s like a strong fabric smell that doesn’t go away
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but a little unsteady!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this cat tree, it came in fast and looks great but I gave it a 4 out of 5 because it is difficult to put it together, even with two people, and it wobbles a bit when my cat climbs it. I took some cardboard to stick behind it as a stabilizer and it works pretty well. My cat is a 12lb Bengal for reference. Over all a great cat toy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jordyn

customer_reviews.title: Tough for bigger cats to climb, needs extra support to be stable
customer_reviews.text: Love the idea, but there's quite a bit of overlap between the levels and our bigger (long, but lean) cat has trouble making the turn to jump from one level to the next. Our smaller guy can manage it ok. Assembled as instructed, it moves a lot and doesn't stay very tight to the door from the backside. We wound up wrapping a ratchet strap around the middle and using the strap to pull it tighter to the door. Stays a lot more stable, if it is a little uglier. Rev 2 should have platforms that stick out a little more, and some way of addressing the stability issue.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to build but good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This was really hard to build. It took me about two hours and I ended up doing it way too lose. It did not fit my door so I had to flip it upside down. I had my maintenance man fix it. Otto doesn’t use it as much as I thought he would. I like th idea of people putting it on a wall.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking but flimsy, very smelly, and cats don't bother with it at all!
customer_reviews.text: This set of shelves to hang on the door held ZERO interest for my two cats. The shelves may not hold more than a ten pound cat, as it is, as soon as my lighter cat climbed up and the shelf bent downward she jumped right back down. The upright portion that backs onto the door bends outward and does not stay rigid. In addition, the cat climber has a strong odor that did not dissipate after a full week. I would send this item back for a refund but it is quite HEAVY and therefore the return shipping would be outrageous and a pain in the neck. Stuck with it :/
customer_reviews.author: StarryStarryNight

customer_reviews.title: Kitten Paradise
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty heavy duty and extremely durable. My kitten launches herself up it like a ladder and does the zig zag down. It's extremely entertaining for felines and humans. I like it more than I thought it would. When I get a place with more doors I'm buying another or two or three. My older cat doesn't use it at all however, so I would recommend it for more spry critters. Very, very pleased with this product, it is a tad bit annoying to put together, but if your even a little handy you can do it no problem. It's not that it's too heavy, more that it's just awkward to assemble. So worth it though!
customer_reviews.author: Hanna Kat McDeavitt

customer_reviews.title: This thing stole four hours of my vacation day
customer_reviews.text: Let me count the ways that this product is not designed well. - not sturdy enough to hang on door - particle board won’t allow wood screws through so I can’t mount on wall - instructions are bad, with misspellings and not enough information - hard to put together with just one person, have to put it together against gravity without enough hands - color of plank is ugly brown - hole is too small where you have to screw on the nuts so it takes forever, hurt my shoulder and broke my nail... annoying - planks are not wide enough apart horizontally for a cat to comfortably jump down
customer_reviews.author: Theresa Charleston

customer_reviews.title: Useless and flimsy.  Neither cat can get up and down the shelves
customer_reviews.text: We installed this on the side of a bookshelf, not a door. The structure itself is flimsy once put together. It bends and wiggles. This alone made one of my cats avoid it because every time she'd get on it it would shake, and it made her nervous. She's also 13 lbs and so trying to get from one shelf to the other is impossible. You'd think this would be just due to her weight/size, but my other cat is 8.5 lbs and she can't do it either. I have this useless thing now and I've no idea what to do with it. Maybe it's good for kittens, but not my adult cats.
customer_reviews.author: S. Wells

customer_reviews.title: Smells Funky and Hard To Assemble
customer_reviews.text: The product stinks really bad of some sort of formaldehyde. It gave me a headache it was so strong on the first few days. Sprayed it down with air fresheners and gave it time, its not so bad anymore but still stinks at close inspection. Took us 3 tries to put it together. Had to take it all apart once and re-assemble. Assembling is rather difficult, use needle nose pliers. Otherwise the cat seems to enjoy it, scratches it, climbs on it.
customer_reviews.author: Nichole Segura

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Don't waste your time or money. Assembly is frustrating. Probably the worst instruction sheet I have ever seen. The smell of it is super strong and offensive. Cats don't care for it. What a pain to unassemble everything and return it. You have to completely assemble and hang on the door to realize there is no way to tighten it securely to the door.
customer_reviews.author: Buterflycandy

customer_reviews.title: Heavy, but wobbly
customer_reviews.text: You would think by the weight of the box and all the pieces that this would be stable, however, it is very wobbly on the door. It does not fix snuggly enough, so that when the cat jumps on it (or even moves on it) it wobbles. We will likely follow other reviewer recommendations and use velcro between the unit and the door. The instructions were also a joke. Ackward to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: CindelT

customer_reviews.title: Totally Unstable
customer_reviews.text: After a heck of a struggle to assemble this little nightmare, I was immediately struck by how flimsy it is. Once mounted on the door, it bows and wobbles so much that my cat was too afraid to step on it. I kept it in my house for a month, trying all sorts of ways to introduce him to it and improve stability, but this thing's too much of a piece of junk. I ended up giving it away for free on Craigslist.
customer_reviews.author: Caroline Gimello

customer_reviews.title: One of Our Cats Favorite Hangouts
customer_reviews.text: Like another reviewer, I tightened and re-tightened as I assembled this, and it is very stable on the door. The small movement doesn't bother my cats, but they are motivated by the bird feeder on the outside of the screen. I am not seeing much wear and tear as they nap out here and try to catch birds through the screen, so after ten months of use, it is still in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE! it moves so much that the cats are ...
customer_reviews.text: HORRIBLE! it moves so much that the cats are scared to death of it due to the noise every time it hits the door. I tried to get my money back and the company has ignored my email. DO NOT BUY! What a waste of money and now i have to pay someone to take it to the DUMP!
customer_reviews.author: J. Westbrook

customer_reviews.title: Pretty neat concept, but suggestion to easier way of assembling...
customer_reviews.text: The cats haven't quite bought into it, but I think it's pretty cool. There were challenges putting it together per the instruction guide, but if you lay it upside down using the shelves to support it and pieces to brace the sections, it finally went together. The bottom brace is spring-loaded, so just need to extend it under the door. Doesn't work on a door that has stripping underneath (like an exterior door).
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: Measure your door
customer_reviews.text: Measure your door before buying this product. The extension was about an inch too short. We managed to move a couple screws and could mount it securely, but we have to stuff towels behind it because of the bowing issue others mentioned in their reviews. Also, we have two adult tom cats that find it difficult to turn around and climb to the next level. (They are agile otherwise, so I am pretty sure it's the angles created by the length of the platforms.) They eventually got used to it, though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to assemble, unstable. Save your money. Get a cat tree instead.
customer_reviews.text: My handyman assembled this and said it was unnecessarily complicated and took too long to assemble. My cats tried to jump up on the first rung and ran away because it was unstable. They are afraid of it now. My handyman is returning to bolt it to the door but I fear my cats might not try it again. I’ll put treats on it and hope for the best. I bought it to help my cats jump up on shelves I am having installed for them. I probably should have just bought another cat tree.
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Takes time but now my cat loves it
customer_reviews.text: This was very easy to put together and pop up on the door. Like others have mentioned, it’s not super stable and does wobble a bit, so it took some time for my cat to feel comfortable climbing it. Now, a couple months later, he is CONSTANTLY sitting and climbing on this thing. It’s given him the ability to play his two favorite games- ‘leap on unsuspecting visitors heads from above’, and ‘stare condescendingly at the dogs’. He gives it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: A Climbing Cats Dream
customer_reviews.text: This thing is incredible! OK - this may sound crazy, but my son was moving to another state and has 3 cats. When we finally got them to their new home we set up new toys for them to play with. The old toys were there too, so don't worry. Just wanted to make their experience in the new place as fun as it could be. We took the advice of past reviewers and attached it to a wall. The cats went bonkers over this thing. Each shelf was attached to the wall independently so we did not experience any buckling or swaying. Made the kitties happy so I'm happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen Hatzfeld

customer_reviews.title: Obnoxious assembly, but cats love it
customer_reviews.text: This loses 2 stars for the ridiculous complexity of the assembly. You think Ikea is bad? Oh just wait until you get this. Looking back, I wouldn't have bought this had I knew assembly was so awful. Took us nearly an hour to get the wood aligned and the screw like bracket things correctly aligned too. Then took another 15-30 minutes to properly get the screws tightened one section at a time. So, idea is nice, but putting it together is HELL Update 27 Nov 2018: increasing stars from 3 to 5 because after almost 2 months the cats just love it. It has helped increase space for them in our small apartment.
customer_reviews.author: Josh L

customer_reviews.title: Good for indoor-only cats to get the height they like
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I lived in an apartment and my cat was kept indoors 24/7. She absolutely loved being able to climb up high to survey her territory, and it made for a great jungle gym when she played with her toys. I would drag a string up and down the steps and she would have a ball going up and down the steps chasing it. However, when I moved to a house with a yard, I started letting her outside, and that provided her with so much stimulation she lost a lot of interest in this item. She still uses it from time to time but not nearly as much as she used to.
customer_reviews.author: Peter W Sennello

customer_reviews.title: Durable, and the cats love it!
customer_reviews.text: Product as described, very durable (looks and works great a year later), and the cats still love it! It smacks the door a bit, but if you put some kind of cushioning on the back of the climber, or use some screws to attach it to the door, I'm sure any noise would be taken care of. Also, it's a great space-saver! It was one of our first big purchases for the cats, and I'm so glad we got it. They love the scratching-post material between the shelves, in addition to being able to climb all over.
customer_reviews.author: CK

customer_reviews.title: Only buy if you're wall mounting
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this and for it to work. But it just was not sturdy - even after tightening all the way down. I am pretty adept at building things but I could not get this to work for our three 7-10 lb cats. The brackets were also too wide for the door and a piece of wood needed to be placed in the gap to prevent it from sliding on the door frame or making a loud bang every time one of the cats jumped off. I wish we didn't rent - I would have put it up on the wall instead but drilling holes wasn't an option.
customer_reviews.author: V Sansonetti

customer_reviews.title: Nice climber. My cats were a little hesistant to ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice climber. My cats were a little hesistant to use it at first, but then I tightened it up and they've been enjoying it. When putting it together, tighten the bolts as much as you can. Like seriously, just keep tightening. Even when you think they are tight enough. Just keep going. Then ask someone else to do the same. It makes a big difference.
customer_reviews.author: Pitbulls rule

customer_reviews.title: Definitely would buy this again -- for wall mount, not door
customer_reviews.text: I saw a hack where someone bought one of these, removed the door mount hardware, and bolted it (to a stud) on the wall. My husband did that and the cats now enjoy being able to scale the shelves to the top of a tall piece of furniture in our dining room, and they absolutely love it! The only con I can think of with regard to this item: the shelves themselves could be mounted a bit more securely--they do sag just a tad when the cats jump on them (both cats are normal weight, between 7-8 lbs). See photo.
customer_reviews.author: Arthur G. Ray

customer_reviews.title: More for smaller cats!
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea of this item. I got two for my cat to put on top of each other to built a really high climber for outdoor from second story down to first floor buttttttt the shelves should have been more seperated... this is more for kitten my cat is big and could only land with her front paws on the lower shelve and almost flipped over with her back body cuz she had no space to land with her feet. Complicated to explain but the shelve should have been more to the right and the above one more to the left.
customer_reviews.author: Sami Moheb

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a small apartment
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a cat tree but literally had nowhere to put it in our small Chicago apartment. This was the perfect solution. Great quality and my cat seems to like it. The reason i gave it 4 stars was that fresh out the box it smells sooooo bad. Like had to wash my hands after wards and took a few days to stop smelling up my place. Sticker on the back said it has formaldehyde? why tho?
customer_reviews.author: Kyle S.

customer_reviews.title: Solid buy.
customer_reviews.text: Solid four. It took a while for my cats to get used to this. I think the product may be good for thicker doors, but in my apartment the tree has wiggle room on the door itself (the brackets are too wide.) Which spooked my cats at first as it wiggled when they'd jump on it. Also due to this wiggle, when they jump on or off, it's noisy. But now that the cats have adjusted, they nrrally enjoy it. They are climbing it constantly. Overall 4 stars. I like the floor space it saves, and it does the job it's meant to do.
customer_reviews.author: lee Yzquierdo

customer_reviews.title: May Be Difficult for Larger Cats
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put together and love how easily it attaches to a door. Good, sturdy product! Only issue (not the sellers fault) is my cats won’t use it. I’ve tried everything to get them going, but a month later, no takers. My youngest cat is a climber, but she is a bit chunky and the shelves may be a bit thin for her...and even though the shelves are staggered it’s hard for a larger cat to to turn or balance in order to move higher. Despite my cats rejecting it, it is a solid product and I plan to pass it on to another friend who has smaller cats.
customer_reviews.author: Mich

customer_reviews.title: BRILLIANT
customer_reviews.text: Makes my cats happy, therefore makes me happy. They hop from the top rung to the top of the armoire to nap. Works well with door open or closed (see pics). Will need a couple of screws for stability. Relatively easy to assemble. If you can assemble baby gear (cribs, strollers, swings) you can assemble this. I had no trouble assembling and hanging it by myself. I am a 45 y.o. woman.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Looks good but unstable and unused
customer_reviews.text: Much less stable than I thought it would be. None of our 4 cats will use it (two older cats, two kittens). Installed as directed and no, I'm not drilling holes in my door or mounting it on the wall. It's supposed to work on an interior door. It looks good, but the shelves are too small and it's hard for cats to change levels when we place them on it. Looking for a friend to give it to now. Maybe they'll have better luck/
customer_reviews.author: Chalice Bailey

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work well
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to order this; however, the platform boards are not off centered enough for the cats to climb. They can get to the first one and then there isn't enough room to hop/climb to the next ones. Bought this for my daughters cats and they just can use it as shelving because the cats don't have enough room to jump from one to the next. Pretty disappointing...
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble once you figure out minor details - I attached a picture that may be helpful
customer_reviews.text: My cat had not used this yet so we shall see we wanted something to put food higher up since our dog eats everything in sight. Now I put together a lot of items and am pretty handy but the instructions didn’t show just how the bolts should go and the instructions were a bit confusing. So I attached photos to help others with assembly. Plus if you are not used to putting things together they have two little wrenches for a reason one is to hold the bolt on place while you tighten the other end.
customer_reviews.author: Lola

customer_reviews.title: Good construction
customer_reviews.text: Is great construction. A bit difficult to put the pieces together because you need support underneath as you attach the levels together. Make sure you measure the door size. After I put it together, it did not fit the length of the door. Overall. If it fits for you? The cats will love it
customer_reviews.author: Jupiter

customer_reviews.title: the picutre makes it look like there's a LOT more space for a cat to ...
customer_reviews.text: the picutre makes it look like there's a LOT more space for a cat to move up and down tiers. mine, the holes were drilled almost to the center of the peices, so my cat has like 2 inches to get down. If he's on the highest one, he freaks out. I'm going to take it apart and drill my own holes. If I break it, oh well. I just won't buy it again. Also, was a bit of a nightmare to put together. maybe do that with 2 people if you can. I did it myself onthe floor of my living room and it was a headache. plus just awkward to move around.
customer_reviews.author: iBuyStuff

customer_reviews.title: The photo clearly shows that a full-size cat cannot easily "jump" from one level to the next
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this unit with the intention of attaching it directly to a wall, which I did. I feel the product is OK and would consider purchasing it again but I do have a few comments. As other have mentioned it is somewhat difficult to assemble. Once together it is slightly flexible which I believe would be a problem if hung from a door as designed. The photo clearly shows that a full-size cat cannot easily "jump" from one level to the next. For my application I wish the platforms were lightly longer to make it easier for the cat to move up and down.
customer_reviews.author: Surfertom99

customer_reviews.title: Excited... but disappointed :(
customer_reviews.text: I'd love to give a full review for this as I was very excited to purchase this for my kitties... however one of the four shelves does not have the predrilled holes in it therefore I cannot install it completely. I don't own a drill myself so I cannot fix this problem... if Smartcat could PLEASE promptly send me a shelf with the predrilled holes, I will gladly update my review.
customer_reviews.author: Jin Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Smelly but Straightforward
customer_reviews.text: The instructions were a little difficult for me to parse at first, but it all goes together really easily if you're much better at spatial cognition than I am. The bottom hook piece slides to fit a variable of door lengths. Unfortunately, this apartment has doors for giants so I had to make some adjustments. It smells really awful though. I've had it for over a month and it still smells like whatever noxious glue they used. My cats don't seem to care though?
customer_reviews.author: Emilio

customer_reviews.title: Best cat climber/scratcher investment. So durable and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I hate assembling furniture but this was so easy to assemble a real no Brainer. I've had it for two years with five cats. They all use it and love it. I put it on the bathroom door. And every time I go to the in the bathroom they follow me and climb all over it while I'm getting ready in the mornings. It has lasted so long and I'm in awe because they really put it to good use. It bow but barely at all. Just make sure you tighten the shelves enough so that it's not wobbly. I just got a bigger house and I love this thing so much i plan on purchasing a couple more.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: All the functionality of a cat tree without sacrificing floor space!!
customer_reviews.text: This is really cool, all the functionality of a cat tree without sacrificing floor space. For me this was initially a little wobbly as there was a sizable space between the door and the back of the shelf. It was bumping around and making noise when the cats jump on/off However a few pieces of rolled up newspaper tucked strategically in the back fills the gap fine and now there is no noise when the cats jump on/off. Can't even see it. I Love It!
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Fits together nicely.
customer_reviews.text: We've been using these units mounted to a wall rather than a door. More sturdy and less noise. The parts fit together perfectly, and assembly was easy. Very sturdy, even for the larger cats using it. Only downside is that the carpet/felt covering on the shelves does wear rather quickly. Ours get used heavily, so it's probably not an issue with average use, and is not a product defect. Besides, our cats love it!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff W. Woehrle

customer_reviews.title: Hard To Build
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a huge pain in the dick to put together. The instructions were difficult to follow; I definitely suggest building with a partner (doing it alone was a challenge). Once completed, the tree seems a bit rickety, but it has admittedly held up for a year now. Wouldn’t recommend for large/heavy cats; mine weigh about 16lbs combined, and anything more than 20lbs looks like it would pull the whole thing apart.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Cat loved it.
customer_reviews.text: My cat absolutely loved this thing and was always on the top level, the only complaint I really have about this is the fact it didn't have the greatest stability issues. So opening and closing my door I would hear this tap against it. I ended up taking it down as I didn't want to ruin my door, but if not for that I would of kept it. I wasn't really fond of the price either, because I feel like it should of been made better for that price.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Codere

customer_reviews.title: Big waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.text: This item was really not worth the price! It was very difficult to construct,particularly with the tiny tools included.. Very time consuming and when I was done,it really didn't fit snugly to the door as it was supposed to. My cats won't sit on it because it bounces back and forth on the door. So actually it has turned into a catch all or extra shelves for me. I would not recommend this to anyone especially a friend.
customer_reviews.author: TarotReader666

customer_reviews.title: A good idea that could be easily improved with an extra strap...
customer_reviews.text: So this works alright. The biggest issue is that it sort of bows outward in the center and, consequently, isn't the most stable. Skittish cats might be turned off, but my cat was fine with it. After noticing the bowing out, I wrapped a thin, elastic belt underneath the second shelf and around the door, buckling it on the other side. It's much more secure now. Supplying a strap with this product would improve it significantly. But, eh, it works. Pros: - Easy to put together - Easy to put up and take down - No holes in the wall - Small footprint Cons: - Kind of bows out in the middle - Cheap felt on the platforms
customer_reviews.author: HEnriquez

customer_reviews.title: Not well made
customer_reviews.text: The tree is a pain to assemble and hang on the door. Why? It's heavy when assembled. Further, the spring that is designed to tension the tree, holding it to the door, is not strong enough to perform its purpose. The result is that the thing hangs loosely off the top of the door, swaying limply whenever one of our cats jumps up. The treads are covered with a very light duty carpet. The cats will shred it soon.
customer_reviews.author: grumpyoldguy

customer_reviews.title: Good alternative to a space-consuming cat tree!
customer_reviews.text: My cat uses it to just jump up and down. My cat jumps off the second step itself. He doesn't sit and rest on it or anything since the door is not closer to a window. Also like other reviewers mentioned, it does seem flimsy especially in the middle and my cat took some time getting used to that "uncertainty". That's why the 4 stars. The piece itself is sturdy and hasn't come apart. I like that this doesn't have any footprint and take up space in my condo. Great concept and design. Just needs some fastening in the middle so it doesn't separate from the door.
customer_reviews.author: sugarjar

customer_reviews.title: My cats are unimpressed
customer_reviews.text: Fairly easy to put together if you use the tools provided. However it is much easier with 2 people. Once together this is fairly heavy and awkward to move so assemble it as close as possible to where you wish to hang it. Our cats were unimpressed and have yet to use it. I am unable to close the door once I hung this. This may be the door or the product, unable to tell. We have custom doors in our house, so I was only able to hang it on my closet door, which is a standard width. My closet is carpeted, which may or may not add to why I cannot close the door with the product attached.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great door cat tree for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great door cat tree for the price. Like other reviewers mentioned, it's a little wobbly on the door if not secured. I put some sponges​ between the climber and the door and that helped keep it from wobbling around.
customer_reviews.author: Marlie

customer_reviews.title: Requires a very specific door
customer_reviews.text: We could only find one door in our eintire house that fit the height and width properly, and it’s ina sally inconvenient spot. We wanted it for our patio doors so the cats could see out, but the hooks are not wide enough to go over the door. We considered a closet, but the spring wouldn’t secure it enough for the cats to use safely. So now it’s on a basement door never being used - but it technically fits 😞
customer_reviews.author: S. D'Anna

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use, sturdy, good materials. Cat loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this ladder. The choice of materials is good for both the shelves and the backboard. She has ignored all other scratching posts, but likes to scratch the back of this one. This is easy to install and move to different doors, and it is sturdy. I did tuck a folded towel behind the ladder and the door to keep it from rattling against the wood of the door, though. That works well. The ladder does wiggle when the cat climbs on it, but that doesn't seem to bother my cat at all.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: The fabric on the shelves is like a thin felt type fabric
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my monster a few weeks ago - it was a little overwhelming for a kitten. The fabric on the shelves is like a thin felt type fabric, so he doesn't have the size or strength to grab and hold on, but now at 13 weeks old, he is getting good at making it to the 3rd perch and diving for the bed - or calling me over so he can climb onto my shoulders to get down :)
customer_reviews.author: Heather R.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't assemble this on my own. Not a difficult concept, just physically impossible to hold the components together and tighten the nuts to hold it together. Doesn't fit on any of my doors well, flexes in the middle, the "spring loaded" portion doesn't hold tension at all. I plan to keep it and mount parts of it on my walls into the studs
customer_reviews.author: nightshift

customer_reviews.title: Cats loved it, so I do too!
customer_reviews.text: Although these are not the most convenient things to use because they do rock a little, making noise and scraping the top of the door a bit, I used mine a LONG time and love it still, remembering the young cats that played on it. I even named one who particularly loved it "Monkee" for the way he raced up and down it like it was a tree, and hung off the shelves with one foot just like the critter after which he was named. Anything that entertaining for a cat/kitten gets my vote!
customer_reviews.author: D. Parker

customer_reviews.title: I bought two for my friend and as I was ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two for my friend and as I was trying to install it onto a wall, it fell over and broke. No loss however, I took the pieces and created an entire wall of random shelving. The one in my house is solid. Very worth the money. I have never put mine on the door and I wouldn't imagine it to be quite solid on a door. Just grab a drill, find a beam, some washers, and thick screws to put it into your wall.
customer_reviews.author: ayse

customer_reviews.title: Can’t shut the door
customer_reviews.text: This climber is really nice but there is a big flaw! It does not allow you to shut the door it’s handing on closed. The hanger hardware they used has to be heavy duty in order to hold the weight (it’s heavy) and there is a bottom one that attaches too so it’s sturdy. But it so heavy duty you can’t the door with it on. Other then that it awesome. Thinking of screwing it to the wall instead.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 3 boys

customer_reviews.title: This is a pretty cool cat climber
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty cool cat climber, though the cats don't use it much. It's actually used as shelves more than the cast use as a climber, but that could just be my cats. It was kind of a pain to put together. Especially with the wrenches that came with. I ended up borrowing a ratchet wrench to save my fingers the pain.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Overall a good choice if you want to save floor space. Consider putting it on a wall instead of a door!
customer_reviews.text: My kittens like this, and I am pleased overall with the purchase. It's a good choice for those with floor space considerations. I find the material lining on the shelves to be of lower quality than expected/hoped for, and I am sure it will fray soon from the kittens' claws. The design is a bit lacking--the post should be in one piece for more stability. And I almost cried from frustration while putting this thing together. It definitely needs two people to assemble. Tip: Put it on a door you don't need to open frequently or walk by. It's more stable with the door closed, and cats like to use it to ambush those who walk by unsuspecting attack. :)
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Takimoto

customer_reviews.title: SHAKING STAND!! CATS RUN!!!  NOISY & WORTHLESS!! EVEN W DUCT TAPE!!
customer_reviews.text: After completing assembly and attaching to door (they don't show you that in video- I LATER found online) the cats wouldn't get on the stand. I put catnip on it & toys. It rattled and vibrated. I even duct taped it to the door at top, bottom, inside & out. It still shook. The cats won't come near it. It can't be returned. DON'T BUY THIS NOISY ITEM!! WORTHLESS!!!!!! It's not even a good plant stand!
customer_reviews.author: Kerrie Ingle

customer_reviews.title: Queen Approved
customer_reviews.text: My Khaleesi took right to it!... I assembled it (easily) and mounted it directly to a wall as I didn't have a suitable door available. My cat immediately perched up on the top platform and overlooked her kingdom... As you can see in the picture, I didn't fully assemble it due to space constraints (tiny house) but now I do have a couple of spare pieces that I can use as replacements if/when something wears out.
customer_reviews.author: Jared H.

customer_reviews.title: Cats won’t touch it
customer_reviews.text: Don’t know what kit others got, but mine was a pain to put together. Have tried putting this in several different places in the house, but not one of my cats will touch it. Zero out of five cats - not even the bottom levels. Waste of money. It holds the mail and cat treats. (Turns out its the only place where they’re safe, go figure.)
customer_reviews.author: S. Proctor

customer_reviews.title: TOO COOL FOR SCHOOL!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this! Removed the door hangers and affixed to my wall, so the kitties had a way to move around the huge big hairy dog I adopted! They love their wall stairs and are on it daily. The only thing I would change is to make the shelves a little wider. I have Maine Coon cats and they are almost too large to fit!
customer_reviews.author: Pixie

customer_reviews.title: Works great for our kitten while mounted on a wall.
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect for helping out kitty to climb I the top bunk of our child’s bed. It is very study when assembled directly to the wall. It was put together and hung easily by my husband in less than an hour. Our 10 week old kitty is learning to navigate it quite well so far and it’s only been up for a day.
customer_reviews.author: ScheiberTime

customer_reviews.title: Kitty apporved
customer_reviews.text: I give it 5 stars because our playful boys took right to it and started fighting up and down it right away. So it was a huge hit with our cats. On the negative. It bows out from the door a bit. I thought about it being the spring at the bottom but the kitties decided that the space between the climber and the tree was perfect for sneak attacks. So maybe I'll just leave it. It doesn't rattle or bang so not a big deal. Just remember to keep going back and tightening all the hardware. I checked them all while it was leaning against the door and some had loosened up.
customer_reviews.author: DonOmite

customer_reviews.title: Horrible.
customer_reviews.text: Most complicated thing to put together ever. Took me 45 minutes. It is so wobbly I immediately took it down because there was no way I am letting my cats jump on it. Once i took it down one of the levels jiggled right off. Horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Horsley

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, needs enhancement
customer_reviews.text: Assembly was relatively simple. The first issue is the device does not attach to the door with steady stability. The first time a cat jumped on a platform, it wobbled on the door so much the cat jumped off, making for additional unsteadiness. Also, the platforms are not really wide enough for a cat to ascend or descend from one to another.
customer_reviews.author: Richard L Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Great as a scratcher, but top shelves didn't work for my cat.
customer_reviews.text: This works well as a scratcher for my 5 year old, 12 lb cat, but not so well to introduce a lot of vertical space. She enjoys the first shelf and sometimes ventures up to the second shelf. She has climbed all the way to the top just fine but had a lot of trouble climbing down. The steps are just not long or wide enough for her to safely make it to the next level down. We ended up removing the top two shelves so that she can sit on the second shelf and stretch up as high as she likes to scratch.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Death from above!!
customer_reviews.text: Our 10 week old kittens love this thing! It really takes two people to easily put this together. It is possible for one patient, coordinated person with a bottle of wine. If you are not mechanically inclined, I recommend watching the video that is listed on the instructions. Also we had to tweak the ends to make it fit on the door. But totally worth it... Just watch out for dismounting kittens when you walk by!
customer_reviews.author: Hockey Girl

customer_reviews.title: THIS IS NOT THAT EASY TO ASSEMBLE
customer_reviews.text: THIS IS NOT THAT EASY TO ASSEMBLE. You can't tighten anything until it is all assembled, and you can't lay anything flat because then it all disconnects. I spent probably an hour trying to put it together by myself before giving up and shoving it into the closet. In theory it should be easy, but in actuality, make sure you are assembling this with at least one other person and maybe a bottle of wine. Also it is a lot heavier than I expected. Just be prepared when you go to lift the amazon box, it is heavier than you would think.
customer_reviews.author: Emily T.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Directions are lacking. Need to be better.
customer_reviews.text: Just received and went to put it together and the instructions are very lacking and not very clear. I had to youtube it to figure out how to put it together. It also has a really strong odor to it, though I'm sure that will go away eventually. My cats have not used it yet and may not for a bit til the odor dissipates. It does seem like it will be a great place for my fur babies to hang out but we shall see. It seems pretty sturdy, just wish the directions were a little more clear.
customer_reviews.author: Iesha

customer_reviews.title: Ordered, it for the cat that likes heights. ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered, it for the cat that likes heights. He is a little too chuncky, (16). He has a hard time turning his body around and jumping up to next level. I ordered another one to stagger them from one wall to another and added the refined cat cloud as the resting spot above my desk.
customer_reviews.author: Gina MacKay

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you stager the shelves correctly.
customer_reviews.text: Money well spent! Moved my cat from a large house that was safe for outdoor play, to a one bedroom apartment on a busy street. Because Luna can't go outside and climb her favorite tree anymore this was a must in order to keep her off the counters. She can climb and peek outside. Shelves are sturdy and have fabric that she can really cling to. Assembly was a little bit of a pain and a two person job. We accidentally put the top shelf on wrong, but it gives her a extra fun challenge.
customer_reviews.author: shastina blaylock

customer_reviews.title: I thought this would be perfect for my cats and a way to save space
customer_reviews.text: I thought this would be perfect for my cats and a way to save space . it was a little pricy but I thought it would last forever and boy was I wrong . the bolts are weak to begin with , the idea they had makes so sense , when you put it together its super wobbly and it ripped the top of my door off . I should of listened to the others reviews saying not to purchase this product , I just wasted $65 , on something I had to throw away .
customer_reviews.author: Jonnie

customer_reviews.title: Skip It
customer_reviews.text: These are a PAIN to assemble. I bought three and only (mostly) finished one over the last several years. Plus, if you don't have some decent doors with decent hardware, the weight of this plus the weight of your cat is going to warp how your door hangs. Interesting idea, poor item.
customer_reviews.author: Shrimp

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for two kittens that I adopted. They love it and use it to go up and down from some wall shelves we have set up for the cats. They have used it for months now and it's great. They are full size now and the thing is sturdy enough for them. My older two cats, however, do not like this climber. They're older and don't really jump so that's probably it. So I think it really depends on the cats. Great value if your cats are young and active and trusting.
customer_reviews.author: MensaMom

customer_reviews.title: Solid
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the other posts about difficulty of construction scare you away. With two people, it wasn't bad. We screwed it in to the wall for stability, and the cats love it.
customer_reviews.author: Caitlin Kotnik

customer_reviews.title: I love this.
customer_reviews.text: I love this..... but after I got it mounted on a wall. It’s really hard to have on the back of a door. Makes the door harder to close. Also when I wasn’t putting it on the door it ended up falling and the bottom part broke. I don’t like the design of how it holds together. But since getting it mounted to the wall it’s 1000x better. I bought it with that being my final intent for it. I would say if your getting it for a door... I wouldn’t but if you are getting it to mount on a wall it’s so worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ellie

customer_reviews.title: ... tree for very long but my cat seems to like it. It was pretty easy to put together ...
customer_reviews.text: I have not had the cat tree for very long but my cat seems to like it. It was pretty easy to put together after watching the youtube video. I put it together by myself in about an hour so I was pretty impressed with that. The only reason I'm not giving this 5 stars is because my cat really struggles getting down from the tree because the platforms are pretty narrow. I'm going to do what another reviewer suggested and drill another whole in the platforms to widen the steps up a bit so my cat can get down easier, but other than that a good product to far.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Makes my jungle cats happy, happy, happy!
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately, it took us well over an hour to get this thing put together but we're not the most handy. As soon as we got it on the door though, both of my cats had to check it out. One of them is on it at least part of every single day. We had a tree climber which was okay but this totally blows it out of the water. We have Bengals which love to climb so this is perfect. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: junomacguff

product_meta.title: SmartCat Cat Climber
product_meta.description: Size:4 levelsWhy didn't someone think of this sooner? Designed to hang on any standard door in your home the Cat Climber from SmartCat is the perfect choice for smaller homes or people who dont want to swap an end table for a traditional cat tree. Now your cat can scratch play sleep and exercise safely on this patented product. The climber is easily moved from door to door because of its spring loaded bracket system. The natural sisal post is ideal for scratching. Made of durable wood the climber will withstand years of use. "I have three in my house one for each cat " says designer Angela Moser. Our cats love it when we move them around the house its like a new adventure for them." Rigid construction for years of use Patented technology Easy assembly & disassembly Provides hours of entertainment Great source of exercise Enhances home decor Space saving - fits on virtually any door
feature_bullets: Great unit for scratching, climbing, sleeping, and exercising
Natural sisal post is ideal for scratching
Spring-loaded bracket system makes it easy to move from room to room
Easy assembly. Each carpeted platform is 17X8.5X1 (L X W X H) inches
Fits on virtually any door from 79 to 82 inches high.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
